result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Viesca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse A. Viesca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse A. Viesca was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $100  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Adriana G, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Jesse A. Viesca, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Credit for 2 days if revoked.  Fined $100 plus costs to be paid during probation.  No contact with Adriana G. w/o court approval.   Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing rescheduled to 2/25/15 at 1:10 PM pending confirmation from Atty Watson.
Court has reviewed & approves request to adjourn sentencing on 2/5/15 with no objection by the State.
Email correspondence received from Aty Watson requesting to adjourn sentencing on 2/5/15.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Jesse A. Viesca, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Count 1- Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 2/5/15 at 11:30 AM.
